transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (puts his head down momentarily) Storm's a-comin'.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) Mmm, time to go to the commissary. Got to eat me some Jell-O. I like green! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (in high voice, to Moltar) Are you doin' that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Pain... pain... pain hurts! It burns!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (paging through book) It seems that the static electricity from the oncoming storm is triggering a.. microinductor.. dylfilabro...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, oh oh oh oh. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Not a word I use every day.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, what is that? Like, lightning?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You mean you're scared of it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Stop lying, Zorak! We're all so very sick of your lies!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar! Get me a meteorologist now!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It's just a little space storm!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do it! Zorak, play me to the desk.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays Space Ghost to the desk with ragtime piano, and continues to play in background; Space Ghost walks to his desk) Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Did you just walk to the desk?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (scribbling) I don't talk to big fat liars whose lies we're all so - (thunder sounds; Space Ghost makes gibbering noises)

transcript.speaker: Mark McEwen
transcript.dialogue: (to Moltar) Ah. The answer, O talk dark handsome stranger...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (to Mark) Hang on, big boy. (throws lever, puts Space Ghost on his monitor) What!?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ehhh... (throws lever, Garrett appears on his monitor)

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: I got some questions I wanna ask this sucker.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Alright, let me get a level from you.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Now, if you have any problems, like if you're not getting enough oxygen...

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Y'see, I thought you were real, but you said if I had any problems, so you know what I mean, I just came with the problem, I need some cash.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen... (thunder clap) Aaaah! (hides under his desk)

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Don't disappear! Don't disappear! Where are you going?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still hiding under his desk, peeks up over edge) Dropped my pen.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: That's Creole for "let's go", you know.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, it means "little one, let's go."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Vamanos ale titi. (thunder clap) Aaay! (hides under his desk again)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (talking to Garrett from under his desk) Well, look what we have here. Greetings citizen, welcome to the big show.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Greetings, uh, citizen, uh, I'm glad to be on the show.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I am, uh, Garrett, uh, Morris, uh, 101.

transcript.speaker: Mark McEwen
transcript.dialogue: And stop blamin' me. When there's bad news, they don't blame Dan Rather, do they?

transcript.speaker: Mark McEwen
transcript.dialogue: But when it's bad weather, they blame me.

transcript.speaker: Mark McEwen
transcript.dialogue: (in Elvis voice) Thank you very much, big guy.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Do they, like, believe in cash out there in the universe?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still under his desk) What's this now?

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: (sings) Some people, got to have it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't have any money (stands up)

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: (sings) Do things, do things, do things, good things with it.

transcript.speaker: Mark McEwen
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) If I could control the weather, I would own the Space Ghost talk show, because if people, if I could control it, it would be Mark McEwen's Weather Controlling.

transcript.speaker: Mark McEwen
transcript.dialogue: And, I'd live in Hawaii, I'd be a lot fatter, and I'd have a hula hoop, one of those skirt things on. I'd be topless, sittin' around, just kinda drinkin', y'know, ice teas and eatin', like, chocolate chip cookies. Rich.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I like the way you jiggle, weather man.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Hey, man, I be listenin' to jazz all the time. That was Ebonics, I just said, "I be".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Right. (thunder clap) (goes back under his desk)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, that ain't the Queen's English!

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: I know that. "I am listening to jazz all the time."

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Well, see, I knew he had broken the code, so I said "I be listenin'", so he understands what I'm sayin'. Some other guy might say "What's he saying, what, huh?"

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (back in his seat) Is there anything more funny than somebody just drastically white trying to speak colloquial hood?

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: I'm, you're the first person I've heard admit that, I've been wantin' to say that, but I say, they'd probably say I'm... (knocks microphone off, feedback)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (to Mark) So, what's your forecast? Any black holes?

transcript.speaker: Mark McEwen
transcript.dialogue: Uh, aren't black holes those things you wanna stay away from?

transcript.speaker: Mark McEwen
transcript.dialogue: So, I mean, you'd predict them, then, like, you'd run away from 'em.

transcript.speaker: Mark McEwen
transcript.dialogue: ... because they'd suck your, the rocket right into the black hole thing. See, I've done a little bit of research on this.

transcript.speaker: Mark McEwen
transcript.dialogue: If you have a black hole, and you got a rocket ship, it just kinda goes in, and then you never see 'em again, so you run from those things.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: That makes sense. If you're yella. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Mark McEwen
transcript.dialogue: We tend not to make fun of stuff like that.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Hey, you know about the ??, you know about that ngupa dust?

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: You don't know about that, huh, man? You notice I'm talkin', now I know the language, I'm takin' me over, y'see, the metaphysical is takin' me over.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: But anyway, I don't wanna say "voodoo" or "voudoun" or nothin' like that, because I know that when you people see this thing (pointing at his ring) you always think (very low voice) "voodoo, voudoun" (sky turns dark, with lightning & thunder) You know, I talk about African medicine. Yes, that's where my powers lie. Many many people have, have denied that and found growths, comin' out of their necks.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (from under his desk again) Yeah, thanks to you, buddy.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Well, I just refer back metaphysically to Marie Laveau. You remember the great queen Marie Laveau? Marie Laveau, she was the first, you know...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Am I supposed to be hearing like telephones dialing in here?

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Way back, yeah, there's a story about Marie Laveau, you know, she was so powerful 'til this man, one time, was involved in a case against a friend of hers.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (hiding in his keyboard pod) Where's Zorak? (pops up) Here's Zorak! (continues popping up and down as he talks) Where's Zorak? Here's Zorak! Where's Zorak? Here's Zorak! Here! Gone! I'm here! I'm gone! Here! Gone! Here! Gone!

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: In court, and Marie didn't like that, she goes in with a little piece of paper like this, you know, and the man is arguing, and she sticks the piece of paper, and it touches him, and the man starts stuttering, and lost the case. (shot of Zorak's empty keyboard pod) You think I'm lying?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh, Garrett, can I stop you for a sec?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak? (keyboard pod is still empty) Zoooraaak! (keyboard pod is still empty) Garrett, did you happen to see where Zorak went?

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Um, him and the garbage person?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Green guy, with the vest. He was just there.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Oh, that guy, Zorak, yeah, praying mantis type guy.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, y'know, that makes me feel sick. Ick! Creepy crawly, you know, ick!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (pokes his head up) You've got a fat rump!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak Robert, you show yourself this instant!!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All right, little man, I'm counting to three! One! Two! Three! (lightning flash)

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Four? (Space Ghost falls) Oh my God, he's gone! Shucks!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You're not a real meteorologist, are ya?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You're freakin' me out here, Mark. Okay?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (hiding under his desk) Eighteen... nineteen... twenty!

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Well, I still wanna say somethin'.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: I think it's shameful, that you are supposed to be a crimefighter...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (risen from beneath his desk) What are you getting at?

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: And believe me, crime is out there in the street.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: And here we have a hero, with all these powers, who decides to come in and be a talk show host.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Well, what about all the crime that's goin' on out there, ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You, sir, are thinking about Earth crime. That's galaxies away from me.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: Of using your powers for positive contribution to society.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: I don't understand what I'm saying either. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let's just call it a day, shall we, Garrett? I can finish my show, and you can just... go... someplace.

transcript.speaker: Garrett Morris
transcript.dialogue: I guess I don't understand something about this sort of thing.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, you said somebody's gonna get hurt!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh. Where did I hear that? I musta read it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: All this bedlam around us... it's not a storm at all! It's a fair!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is this the one that they've added the weather man to? Yeah, that'll be funnier.
